definition: The central and densest part of an atom, composed of protons and neutrons, around which electrons orbit. It is typically referred to in the context of atomic physics and nuclear science.

examples.german: Der Atomkern besteht aus Protonen und Neutronen.
examples.english: The atomic nucleus consists of protons and neutrons.

examples.german: Der Atomkern ist von Elektronen umgeben.
examples.english: The atomic nucleus is surrounded by electrons.

examples.german: Der Atomkern ist der kleinste Teil eines Atoms.
examples.english: The atomic nucleus is the smallest part of an atom.

examples.german: Der Atomkern enth√§lt nahezu die gesamte Masse eines Atoms.
examples.english: The atomic nucleus contains almost the entire mass of an atom.
The atomic nucleus is positively charged.
